laboratory_examinations.findings: Abnormally elevated at 71.6 U/mL (normal range < 1.45 U/mL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum antiGAD-Abs were markedly elevated on all occasions measured over the next year.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Acellular with protein of 48 mg/dL (normal range < 45 mg/dL). AntiGAD-Abs were absent.
Initially revealed normal saccade latencies; lengthening with repetition to exceed 7 s. Saccades were hypometric and slowed after 180 s of horizontal testing and 370 s of vertical testing.
Vacuolated lymphocytes containing glycogen (indicating Pompe disease).
Poor contractility and severe left ventricle hypertrophy.
